1.q_string: If \(\vec{a}=\widehat{i}+2 \widehat{j}+\widehat{k}, \vec{b}=\widehat{i}-\widehat{j}+\widehat{k}\) and \(\vec{c}=\widehat{i}+\widehat{j}-\widehat{k},\) then a vector in the plane of \(a\) and \(\mathrm{b}\) whose projection on \(\mathrm{c}\) is \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\) units, is

Directions: The answer to the following question is a single-digit integer, ranging from 0 to 9. Enter the correct digit in the box given below.

Let \(A, B, C\) and \(D\) be four points such that 

\(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{AB}}=\mathrm{m}(2 \hat{\mathrm{i}}+6 \hat{\mathrm{j}}+2 \hat{\mathrm{k}}) \overrightarrow{\mathrm{BC}}=(\hat{\mathrm{i}}-2 \hat{\mathrm{j}})\)

\(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{CD}}=\mathrm{n}(-6 \hat{\mathrm{i}}+15 \hat{\mathrm{j}}-3 \hat{\mathrm{k}}), \mathrm{AB}\) and \(\mathrm{CD}\) are intercepts of E. If A is the area of the triangle BCE, find the value of [A], where [.] denotes g.i.f.
The value of k for which the points \(A (1, 0, 3), B (– 1, 3, 4), C (1, 2, 1)\) and \(D (k, 2, 5)\) are coplanar, is
A unit tangent vector at \(t=2\) on the curve \(x=t^{2}+2, y=4 t^{3}-5, z=2 t^{2}-6 t\) is

Directions: The answer to the following question is a single-digit integer, ranging from 0 to 9. Enter the correct digit in the box given below.

If \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{d}}\) are position vectors of the vertices of a cyclic quadrilateral ABCD, find the value of \(\left[\left|\frac{|\vec{a} \times \vec{b}+\vec{b} \times \vec{d}+\vec{d} \times \vec{a} \mid}{(\vec{b}-\vec{a}) \cdot(\vec{d}-\vec{a})}+\frac{\mid \vec{b} \times \vec{c}+\vec{c} \times \vec{d}+\vec{d} \times \vec{b}|}{(\vec{b}-\vec{c}) \cdot(\vec{d}-\vec{c})} \right|\right]\)  where [.] denotes g.i.f.

Directions: The following question has four choices, out of which ONE or MORE is/are correct.

Let \(\vec{r}\) be a vector perpendicular to \(\vec{a}+\vec{b}+\vec{c}\) \([\vec{a} \vec{b} \vec{c}]=2, \vec{r}=l(\vec{b} \times \vec{c})+m(\vec{c} \times \vec{a})+n(\vec{a} \times \vec{b}),\) then which of the following statements is/are wrong?

Directions: The answer to the following question is a single-digit integer, ranging from 0 to 9. Enter the correct digit in the box given below.

Consider a tetrahedron with faces \(\mathrm{F}_{1}, \mathrm{F}_{2}, \mathrm{F}_{3}\) and \(\mathrm{F}_{4}\). Let \(\mathrm{u}_{1}, \mathrm{u}_{2}, \mathrm{u}_{3}\) and \(\mathrm{u}_{4}\) be the vectors whose magnitudes are respectively equal to the areas of \(\mathrm{F}_{1}, \mathrm{F}_{2}, \mathrm{F}_{3}\) and \(\mathrm{F}_{4}\) whose directions are perpendicular to these faces in outward direction. Find \(\left|\overrightarrow{\mathrm{u}}_{1}+\overrightarrow{\mathrm{u}}_{2}+\overrightarrow{\mathrm{u}}_{3}+\overrightarrow{\mathrm{u}}_{4}\right|\).
If \(v=2 i+j-k, w=i+3 k\) and \(u\) is a unit vector, then the maximum value of the scalar triple product \([\mathrm{uvw}]\) is

If \(a=2 i+j-2 k, b=i+j\) and \(c\) is a vector such that \(a \cdot c=|c|,|c-a|=2 \sqrt{2}\) and the angle between \(a \times b\) and \(c\) is \(30^{\circ}\) then \(\mid(a \times b) \times c|\) equals

Directions: The answer to the following question is a single-digit integer, ranging from 0 to 9. Enter the correct digit in the box given below.

If the vectors \((a+2) \hat{i}+(2 a-1) \hat{j}-(a-1) \hat{k}\) and \(\sin \theta-\hat{i}+\cos \theta \hat{j}+2 \hat{k}\) are reciprocal to each other, find the value of \(3 \tan \theta,\) which is independent of \(a\).

Directions: The answer to the following question is a single-digit integer, ranging from 0 to 9. Enter the correct digit in the box given below.

If two unit vectors \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}}\) and \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}}\) are acting along tangent and normal at any point \(\mathrm{P}\) on a curve \(\mathrm{y}=\mathrm{f}(\mathrm{x})\), and \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}\) is another vector not coplanar with \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}}\) and \(\vec{c},\) find the value of \(\mid(\vec{a}+\vec{b}) \times(\vec{a}+\vec{c}) \times(\vec{b}+\vec{c})) \cdot(\vec{b}+\vec{c}) \mid\)

In a triangle \(\mathrm{OAB}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{OA}}=\overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{OB}}=\overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}}\). A point \(\mathrm{P}\) is taken on \(\mathrm{OA}\) such that \(\frac{O P}{P A}=3\) and a point \(Q\) is taken on \(O B\) such that \(\frac{O Q}{Q B}=\frac{1}{2}\). If the lines \(\mathrm{AQ}\) and \(\mathrm{BP}\) are perpendicular and \(9 \mathrm{a}^{2}+4 \mathrm{b}^{2}=\mathrm{K} \overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}} \cdot \overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}},\) then find the value of \(\mathrm{K} / 2\).

Directions: The following question has four choices, out of which ONE or MORE is/are correct.

\(\mathrm{ABC}\) is a right-angled triangle at \(\mathrm{A}\). The resultant of the forces acting along \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{AB}}\) and \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{AC}}\) with respective magnitudes \(\frac{1}{\mathrm{AB}}\) and \(\frac{1}{\mathrm{AC}},\) is a force along \(A D,\) where \(D\) is the foot perpendicular from \(A\) on to \(B C\). The magnitude of the resultant force is

Directions: The answer to the following question is a single-digit integer, ranging from 0 to 9. Enter the correct digit in the box given below.

\(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{A}}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{B}}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{C}}\) are the vectors of the sides of a triangle \(\mathrm{ABC}\) such that \(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{A}}=\overrightarrow{\mathrm{B}}+\overrightarrow{\mathrm{C}}\). If the area of the triangle is \(5 \sqrt{6},\) and \(\mathrm{q}\) is the acute angle between the planes \(a x+b y+c z+d=0,\) find the value of \(21 \cos \theta-2\)
